com.compendium.core.datamodel.services
Class MeetingService

java.lang.Object
  com.compendium.core.datamodel.services.Service
      com.compendium.core.datamodel.services.ClientService
          com.compendium.core.datamodel.services.MeetingService
All Implemented Interfaces:
IClientService, IMeetingService, IService, java.io.Serializable
public class MeetingService
extends ClientService
implements IMeetingService, java.io.Serializable

The MeetingService class for interacting with the Database layer. The MeetingService class provides services to manipuate MediaIndex objects in the MediaIndex table and the Meeting table.

See Also:
Serialized Form

createMeeting

public boolean createMeeting(PCSession session,
                             java.lang.String sMeetingID,
                             java.lang.String sMeetingMapID,
                             java.lang.String sMeetingName,
                             java.util.Date dMeetingDate,
                             int nStatus)
                      throws java.sql.SQLException
Adds a new meeting record to the database and returns it if successful.

Specified by:
createMeeting in interface IMeetingService
Parameters:
PCSession - session, the PCSession object for the database to use.
String - sMeetingID, the identifier for the meeting.
String - sMeetingMapID, the identifier for the meetings main map.
String - sMeetingName, the name the user assigned for this meeting.
Date - dMeetingDate, the date of the meeting.
int - nStatus, the status of the meeting.
Returns:
boolean, true if the creation was successful, else false.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException

                         throws java.sql.SQLException
Returns the MediaIndex for given node reference in the given view and for the given meeting.

Parameters:

sViewID, - the id of the view the node is in.
sNodeID, - the id of the node to return the position for.
sMeetingID, - the id of the meeting for the medai index to return.
Returns:
com.compendium.core.datamodel.MediaIndex, the MediaIndex of the node in the view, in the meeting.

java.sql.SQLException
